# Computational details and priors

In order to improve mixing of the MCMC algorithm, we used a reparametrized model updating $\tilde{\beta}=(\tilde{\beta}_0, \tilde{\beta}_1, \tilde{\beta}_2)=(\beta_0+\beta_1\bar{y}, \beta_1, \beta_2)$, where $\bar{y}$ is the mean log-count for the species under study. All parameters are given vague priors; $\tilde{\beta}=(\tilde{\beta}_0, \tilde{\beta}_1, \tilde{\beta}_2)$ are apriori independent $N(0,10^6)$ and scale parameters $\sigma$ and $s$ are assumed apriori uniformly distributed on $(0,1000)$.

Samples from the posterior distributions was simulated using JAGS 4.2.0 called from R [@r_development_core_team_r:_2016] using rjags [@plummer_rjags:_2016]. Figures were based on $10^{10}$ iterations subsampled at every 1000 values and with a burn-in period of 10000. All code is available at https://github.com/mskoldSU/ReproductiveRates 

# Posterior distributions for all species

Here we provide parameter posterior densities and posterior district abundance for the waterbuck (*Kobus ellipsiprymnus*), giraffe (*Giraffa camelopardalis*), Burchell’s zebra (*Equus burchelli*), greater kudu (*Tragelaphus strepsiceros*), blue wildebeest (*Connochaetes taurinus*), impala (*Aepyceros melampus*) and sable antelope (*Hippotragus niger*).
